Package com.example.lotteryevent.repository

Class EventDetailsRepositoryImpl

java.lang.Object
com.example.lotteryevent.repository.EventDetailsRepositoryImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
IEventDetailsRepository
public class EventDetailsRepositoryImpl extends Object implements IEventDetailsRepository
Implements IEventDetailsRepository. This contract defines all the necessary operations for fetching details of a single event and managing the current user's interaction with it (e.g., joining, leaving, accepting).

    • getEntrantStatus

      public androidx.lifecycle.LiveData<Entrant> getEntrantStatus()
      Exposes the current user's entrant status for this event as LiveData. The value will be an Entrant object if the user is involved with the event, or null if they are not logged in or not an entrant.
      Specified by:
      getEntrantStatus in interface IEventDetailsRepository

    • checkAdminStatus

      public void checkAdminStatus(String userId)
      Verifies if the specified user holds administrative privileges by querying the "users" collection.

      The result of this check updates the getIsAdmin() LiveData observable. If the user ID is null, the document does not exist, or the "admin" field is missing, the status is set to false.

      Specified by:
      checkAdminStatus in interface IEventDetailsRepository
      Parameters:
      userId - The unique identifier (UID) of the user to verify.

    • deleteEvent

      public void deleteEvent(String eventId)
      Permanently deletes the specified event and its associated subcollections (e.g., 'entrants').

      This operation performs a batch write to ensure data consistency:

      1. Fetches all documents in the 'entrants' subcollection.
      2. Adds delete operations for each entrant to a batch.
      3. Adds the delete operation for the parent event document to the batch.
      4. Commits the batch atomically.
      On success, the getIsDeleted() LiveData is set to true to trigger navigation.
      Specified by:
      deleteEvent in interface IEventDetailsRepository
      Parameters:
      eventId - The unique identifier of the event to be deleted.

    • deleteOrganizer

      public void deleteOrganizer(String userId)
      Permanently removes the specified user (organizer) and all their associated data.

      This performs a cascade delete operation to ensure database integrity: *

      1. Deletes the User profile document.
      2. Deletes all notifications received by this user.
      3. Deletes all Events organized by this user (including their entrant subcollections).
      4. Removes this user from the waiting lists (entrants) of any other events they joined.
      Specified by:
      deleteOrganizer in interface IEventDetailsRepository
      Parameters:
      userId - The unique identifier of the user/organizer to delete.

    • getIsOrganizerDeleted

      public androidx.lifecycle.LiveData<Boolean> getIsOrganizerDeleted()
      Exposes a boolean flag indicating whether the user (organizer) has been successfully deleted.
      Specified by:
      getIsOrganizerDeleted in interface IEventDetailsRepository
      Returns:
      A LiveData Boolean that becomes true upon successful deletion.

      Specified by:

      Parameters:
